labels.label: Retry Mechanism Template

Method 1: To invoke the Retry Mechanism flow by passing required values
as flowfile attributes.

Method 2: To invoke the Retry Mechanism flow by using the default values
set as ProcessGroup variables.
Initialize attributes for Integration Name.

labels.label: Route flowfiles to be retried based on the Failure type

Retry Functional Failures (Requires file containing list of values of particular
field which have to be retried). The field whose value has to be compared can
be present in either the flowfile content or as attribute
Route the retried flowfiles based on the type of Project

ProcessGroup Variables:
1. Retry.Type - Specifies the type of the Retry mechanism which has to
be applied for the incoming failed flowfiles. (FunctionalFailure, TechnicalFailure)
2. TC.Environment - Specifies the ThreadConnect Environment where
the Retry Mechanism flow is running. (ThreadConnect DEV/STAGE/QA/PROD)
Retry Technical Failures based on: 1. Number of retries 2. Progressive delay between each retries

ProcessGroup Variables:
1. Retry.Functional.Approach - Specifies the location of field based on which flowfile is
being retried. (AttributeBasedField, ContentBasedField)
2. Retry.Field.Name - Specifies the name of the field whose value has to be looked up
within the FF attribute or content to perform retry. (Should be the same as mentioned in
attribute or in the content of FF)
3. Retry.LookupFile.Name - Specifies the file name containing the list of values for the field,
that have to be retried.
4. Report.Failure - This is for reporting. Specifies whether or not reporting has to be done for
flowfiles that don't match the list of values for the field. (Yes, No)
5. Raise.ServiceNow.Ticket - This is for reporting. Specifies whether ServiceNow
incident should be raised or not. (Yes, No)

Groovy script to check the attribute of the incoming failed flowfiles,
whether any of the values for the field mentioned in the file
provided by user matches the corresponding field value in the flowfile attribute. If not present, the flowfile is routed to failure relationship.

Groovy script to check the content of the incoming failed flowfiles,
whether any of the values for the field mentioned in the file
provided by user matches the corresponding field value in the flowfile content. If not present, the flowfile is routed to failure relationship.

Route flowfiles to be retried based on the location of the field.
(FF Attribute or FF Content)
Reporting Utilities

Check what type of Reporting has to be done.
1. Send only email
2. Raise ServiceNow incident and send email.
3. Log flowfile attributes

ProcessGroup Variables:
1. SNow.Desc - Used to populate the description in ServiceNow tool.
2. SNow.Environment - Used to populate the environment for which incident is being reported.
Allowed values ThreadConnect-dev, ThreadConnect-stage, ThreadConnect-qa,
ThreadConnect-prod.
3. SNow.SSO - Used to populate the SSO of the individual creating the incident.
4. SNow.Service - Used to populate the service for which incident is being reported allowed
values ThreadConnect.
5. SNow.Short.Desc - Used to populate the short description in ServiceNow tool.
6. SNow.Urgency - Used to populate the urgency for the incident. Allowed values 1,2,3 for
P1,P2,P3 incidents respectively.
7. SNow.Work.Notes - Used to populate the work notes in ServiceNow tool.
Raise ServiceNow Incident Flow

labels.label: Invoke Email API Flow

ProcessGroup Variables:
1. Email.From - Mentions the ID from which email is being sent.
2. Email.To - Mentions the ID to which email has to be sent.
3. Error.Code - Specifies the Error code for the type of error.
4. Error.Description - Specifies details about the Error.

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.name: Max Length To Put In Attribute

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

entry.value:
INTEGRATION_ERROR - ${integrationName}

INTEGRATION STATUS : FAILED

Error Code ${errorCode}
Error Message ${errorMessage}
Error Description ${errorDescription}
Error Timestamp ${errorTimestamp}
Originator ThreadConnect
Environment ${TC.Environment}

labels.label: Check whether retry is based on count or delay

Check what type of Reporting has to be done.
Either send only email or raise ServiceNow incident and send email.
Reporting Utilities

ProcessGroup Variables:
1. Retry.Technical.Approach - Specifies the approach of the Technical Failures which has to
be applied for the incoming failed flowfiles. (RetryWithCount, RetryWithDelay)
2. Retry.Maxcount - Specifies the maximum number of retry attempts for the
incoming failed flowfiles.
3. Email.From - This is for Email reporting. Mentions the ID from which email is being sent.
4. Email.To - This is for Email reporting. Mentions the ID to which email has to be sent.
5. Error.Code - This is for Email reporting. Specifies the Error code for the type of error.
6. Error.Description - This is for Email reporting. Specifies details about the Error.
7. Raise.ServiceNow.Ticket - This is for reporting. Specifies whether ServiceNow
incident should be raised or not. (Yes, No)

Retry With Delay - Retries Failed flowfiles based on Retry.Maxcount (n), configured
as PG variable or as FF attribute. For every retry flowfiles are delayed for varying
amount of time. After 'n' number of retires the flowfiles are being reported via Email
or Raise Service Now incident and Email.

Retry With Count - Retries Failed flowfiles based on Retry.Maxcount (n) configured
as PG variable or as FF attribute. After retrying 'n' number of times the
flowfiles are being reported via Email or Raise Service Now incident and Email.
RETRY WITH COUNT
Retry With Count Flow

ProcessGroup Variables:
1. SNow.Desc - Used to populate the description in ServiceNow tool.
2. SNow.Environment - Used to populate the environment for which incident is being reported.
Allowed values ThreadConnect-dev, ThreadConnect-stage, ThreadConnect-qa,
ThreadConnect-prod.
3. SNow.SSO - Used to populate the SSO of the individual creating the incident.
4. SNow.Service - Used to populate the service for which incident is being reported allowed
values ThreadConnect.
5. SNow.Short.Desc - Used to populate the short description in ServiceNow tool.
6. SNow.Urgency - Used to populate the urgency for the incident. Allowed values 1,2,3 for
P1,P2,P3 incidents respectively.
7. SNow.Work.Notes - Used to populate the work notes in ServiceNow tool.
Raise ServiceNow Incident Flow
